_header: When Gonewey shall on Curtays call
_description: A prophecy following 6299 in one MS — one 8-line stanza

CamMagPep1236.Transcription:
When gonewey shall on curtays callthen wallys shall rayke &
                    hastely rysethen Albeon skottlonde shall to hem fallthen waken wonders
                    in euery wysethe rode Irlonde fox shall ryse with allwith glaynys
                    grownde & gare men to a gryfeto fell & fende oure fomen
                    allsenym shall sytt in youre asyse
CamMagPep1236.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 316-17.

Bod851.First Lines:
Whan gon awey chal on certeis calleYou wal chal hastly
                    ryse…
Bod851.Last Lines:
…Go fle on fend þu alienis allVn chal sit on þer
                    asise
Bod851.Note:
Between the lines and in the margins: ‘banchidmen frauns Cambria
                    Scotlond Enlond Wales briton’.
